flextable 0.9.10

Set font size

Source: R/styles.R
fontsize.Rd

change font size of selected rows and columns of a flextable.

Usage

fontsize(x, i = NULL, j = NULL, size = 11, part = "body")

Arguments

x

a flextable object

i

rows selection

j

columns selection

size

integer value (points)

part

partname of the table (one of 'all', 'body', 'header', 'footer')

See also

Other sugar functions for table style: align(), bg(), bold(), color(), empty_blanks(), font(), highlight(), italic(), keep_with_next(), line_spacing(), padding(), rotate(), tab_settings(), valign()

Examples

ft <- flextable(head(iris))
ft <- fontsize(ft, size = 14, part = "header")
ft <- fontsize(ft, size = 14, j = 2)
ft <- fontsize(ft, size = 7, j = 3)
ft
